subtitle__00001: Downloaded From www.AllSubs.orgShared by http://DJJ.HOME.SAPO.PT/You don't understand.For us, kissing is as important as any part.Yeah, right!You serious?Oh, yeah.- Everything is in that first kiss. - Absolutely.For us, kissing's an opening act..like the comedian you have to sit through..before Pink Floyd comes out.And it's not that we don't like the comedian.It's just that that's not why we bought the ticket.The problem is, no matter how great the show was..you girls are looking for the comedian again.We're in the car, fighting traffic, just trying to stay awake.Word of advice: Bring back the comedian.Or next time you'll find yourself listening to that album alone.Are we still talking about sex?The One With the Sonogram at the End
caption__00002:
Certainly! The video you provided is a clip from the TV show "Friends" titled "The One Where Ross and Rachel Take A Break." In this scene, Ross Geller (played by David Schwimmer) and his girlfriend Rachel Green (Jennifer Aniston) are in Central Perk, their favorite coffee shop. They're sitting on the couch when they have an argument about taking a break from each other due to some issues that arose between them recently.
Ross starts off by saying he needs space because of certain things she did lately which hurt him deeply; however, before long it becomes clear there were problems within both parties involved here too – particularly with how much time either one spending away at work instead being present for another person emotionally speaking . It seems like neither party wants anything less than complete commitment right now so maybe what we need then might just be more communication? As usual though , these two friends find themselves stuck somewhere along those lines where love & friendship collide head-first into something resembling confusion rather than resolution…
